[[File:Ted Nasmith - Wellinghall.jpg|thumb|right|250px|[[Ted Nasmith]] - ''Wellinghall'']]
'''Wellinghall''' was one of the [[Ent-houses]] of [[Treebeard]], formed by a narrow space in the flanks of [[Methedras]], guarded and flanked by evergreen trees. The roofless 'hall' came to an end in a sheer rock wall, down which flowed a stream welling - hence the name 'Wellinghall' - from the springs of the River [[Entwash]]. The stream flowed down the rocky cliff, and fell across the arched entrance to an inner hall, where [[Treebeard]] kept his meagre furniture. From there, it flowed between the trees that lined the main space, and on to join again with the main flow of the Entwash. 
[[File:Cor Blok - At the Enthouse.jpg|thumb|250px|left|"At the Enthouse" by [[Cor Blok]]]]
Wellinghall is best known as the place where [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] stayed with Treebeard on the night before [[Entmoot]], on [[29 February]] {{TA|3019}}.<ref>{{App|Great}}</ref> It was here that they were first given [[Ent-draughts]] by Treebeard, and so grew to become the two tallest [[Hobbits]] recorded in the histories of [[the Shire]].<ref>{{TT|III4}}</ref>
==Etymology==
[[Treebeard]]'s translation (into the [[Westron|Common Speech]]) for part of the name of his dwelling. It meant "hall (under or behind) the outflow of the spring of Entwash".<ref>{{HM|N}}, p. 778</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
===Wellinghall in adaptations===
<gallery mode="traditional" widths="250px" heights="150px">
File:Wellinghall Layout.jpg|''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]''
Angus McBride - Wellinghall.jpg|''[[Middle-earth Collectible Card Game]]''
The Lord of the Rings Online - Wellinghall.jpg|''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]''
</gallery>
'''1982-97: ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]'':'''
: Wellinghall is the house to which Treebeard most often brings non-Entish visitors. A detailed layout and topography of Wellinghall is provided.<ref>{{ICE|3500}}</ref>

'''1995-8: ''[[Middle-earth Collectible Card Game]]'':'''
:At the site Wellinghall, evil players will face attacks by Awakened Plants. 

'''2013: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'''''
:First visited in a flashback narrated by [[Merry]] and [[Pippin]], Wellinghall sits empty during the present day after Treebeard had gone to [[Isengard]].
